misc.author: antonella_garofalo
misc.post: “This guy” is me, an Italian woman. I admit that I might have chosen the scientific explanation for the Shroud of Turin offered by the Vatican, which is the one I like the most. I hope you appreciate my honesty.
misc.title: Is it Reasonable to Believe in the Resurrection?

misc.author: antonella_garofalo
misc.post: As far as I know Feynman wasn’t a man of faith. I quoted him only because I found interesting that his words could be applied to religious thought.
misc.title: Is it Reasonable to Believe in the Resurrection?

misc.author: antonella_garofalo
misc.post: Hi Yannick! I know that the Vatican is very cautious and doesn’t claim that the Shroud is authentic. However, an American friend went to see the Shroud in Turin and brought back a tape for me. The scientific explanation suggested by the tape was the one from radiations.
misc.title: Is it Reasonable to Believe in the Resurrection?

misc.author: antonella_garofalo
misc.post: I never said that Feynman mentioned the Shroud of Turin. What you are holding against my post is self-evident. I just noticed that the point of view of a scientist may be applied to a matter of faith.
misc.title: Is it Reasonable to Believe in the Resurrection?
